page.title: 04INDUSTRY IN TOPSHAM
page.content: The building of large industrial estates in Exeter has meant that many of Topsham's industries have moved away to better premesis. Until 1984 there was a clock factory in the heart of Topsham which made modern clocks and employed craftsmen to repair old clocks and watches. Likewise, a small glove factory making gloves for industry has moved away. On the quay the fish factory still operates, processing and smoking fish for local use and for export. There is a depot which handles crates of lager and a boatyard which builds and repairs boats by hand. Some of Topsham's small industries include a doll-maker, a furniture maker and restorer , a shoe repairer and a tailor.
